p: The patients with the highest risk of mortality are those who have underlying health conditions that affect their lung health (e.g., asthma, emphysema, and smoking) and those with comorbidities that lower their overall health status (e.g., low vitamin D level, cancer, renal disease, diabetes, and hypertension). Fang et al. (2020) suggest that these comorbidities stem from current angiotensin II receptor blocker medication therapy.
